title:
Jonsas  Think about scripts 
Think about it
Think about it
Think about it
All night long....
And finally decided
This scripts are fake 
congratulation my dear Jonsas 
Your hysteria is already there
There is nothing more sweet  than your desperation

summary: I'm afraid that D&D or even Grrm will degrade, put down Sansa yet again, and/or make her marry her abusers/Jorah(Jonerys...
question: I'm afraid that D&D or even Grrm will degrade, put down Sansa yet again, and/or make her marry her abusers/Jorah(Jonerys theory), make her doormat, handmaid, n subservient towards other characters. It's like how in S4 they make Sansa a game player, then dehumanized her yet again in S5. It's disheartened me. If that happened, I will wait for other Sansa fans with fiction writing skills to share their fan fictions. Perhaps, after I improved my English, then I will write Sansa fan fictions as well.
answer: I had that fear too but now I’m certain it won’t happen. First of lmao @ Jonerys weirdos for thinking Sansa will even look at Jorah’s direction. Second of all in season 7, Sansa was shown to be competent and correct in all her arguments and more once she was compared to Jon, Cersei, Daenerys and Arya favourably. There’s a Vanity Fair article that’s meant to make her look bad long after the season aired without screenshots when the product that the audience saw contradicts the supposed script. Things like that tend to cause panic when they shouldn’t. If Sansa was meant to be subservient towards anyone, the EW article puts an end to it. She doesn’t kiss the ground Jon or Daenerys walk on. She’s prominent on the official poster (third most prominent in fact). Peter Dinklage shot down Sanrion when he said Tyrion was in love with Daenerys. There has been no whiff of Sansan anywhere. Not to mention the spoilers have been pretty sparse on Sansa but what they do tell us is good. There’s only one plot point that I don’t like but it might end up being good when we see it.

summary: EDIT: This has been in my draft for ages and it's killing me! I don't remember writing it! My own cliffhanger is killing me!! ...
body:
EDIT: This has been in my draft for ages and it’s killing me! I don’t remember writing it! My own cliffhanger is killing me!! Where was I going with this? It’s haunting me!

“Just thought about a thing… Jonmund AU where Tormund is part of the local biker gang "the Wildlings” and Jon just moved in the city and started to work at a tattoo parlor (The Crow, the Inkwatch or something idk). His first very big work is on Tormund and they have to do it in several sessions, but it’s Jon that insists on it cause he starts cramping after a while and it’s the safe and health eay to do it (it’s something on his back or two sleeves or neck and below idk). Tormund brags like “pffft we can do it in one day I’m not feeling anything” but Jon’s answer is a deapan “no, now get out”. Jon thinks Tormund is always like that and mostly yeah he is, but he’s also actually trying to impress Jon because he’s cute.

He ends up slipping Jon his number ‘in case he wants to see his finished and healed up work’. Jon probably calls back for a drink or something but he’s really guarded because Tornund is a lot to deal with.

Then all the Wildlings have some charity"

Some charity what??? Damn!

He ends up slipping Jon his number ‘in case he wants to see his finished and healed up work’. Jon probably calls back for a drink or something but he’s really guarded because Tornund is a lot to deal with.

Then all the Wildlings have some charity"

Some charity what??? Damn!

summary: Game of Thrones (S6-E4) ...small men
title: Game of Thrones (S6-E4) ...small men
body:
Daenerys Targaryen: And here, now, what great matters do the Great Khals discuss? Which little villages you’ll raid, how many girls you’ll get to fuck, how many horses you’ll demand in tribute. You are small men. Under you, the Dothraki will be a small people. None of you is fit to lead them. But I am. So I will.

Khal Moro: You crazy cunt. Did you really think we would serve you?

Daenerys Targaryen: You’re not going to serve. You’re going to die.

summary: [Spoilers] Bran could do this....
title: [Spoilers] Bran could do this....
body:
I have an idea that I’ve never heard before and im trying to work with it to see how it would fit.

What if there is actually tunnels under Winterfell that lead to the roots of the Weirwood Tree like I think there is. If so then Bran can go down there, and his powers will be most effective. With that said he’s my idea I’m playing around with.

I don’t see the NK being defeted while on the dragon. I think he’ll have to be knocked off of it and the way that will happen is by Bran Stark warning into him to try and take control of him, which will also take control of flying the dragon to the ground. “You will never walk again but you will fly”.

Maybe when he does this, unknown of whats going on to everyone else, and not knowing Bran has warged the NK Arya or Jamie shoots a Dragon Glass arrow at him knocking him off of the Dragon. It will mirror the first time we see Arya in Winterfell shooting an arrow, and or if Jamie does it, it will mirror him pushing bran out of the tower.

We will see the NK (Bran Stark) fall off the dragon in the same way Bran did from the tower. Possibly the same camera angle, Then when we hits the ground it could knock bran out of his warging mode and back to Bran Stark. Then there we can have one on one combat with Jon and the NK.



Source: https://ift.tt/2E3KcrI

blog.name: literaryheart
blog.title: "Le droit à l'espoir"
blog.description: Marie. 23. French. Dreamer / House stark stan, Jonsa, Game of thrones. The Mentalist, FRIENDS, Sherlock, Elementary, New girl, Community and more

tags: this is not a war post be polite please
summary:
Cheer up Jonsa fam! Easy to say, I know. 

But the validity of the script doesn't cancell our Jonsa ship.

And Jonerys, just...
body: Cheer up Jonsa fam! Easy to say, I know. But the validity of the script doesn’t cancell our Jonsa ship. And Jonerys, just STOP telling us it’s a crackship !!! I’ve never saw this and I’ve been in many fandom. Imagine you are in the HP fandom. Would you day Dromione or Snape/hermione is a crackship ? NO. Thousands of people ship it for years, and it was never prooved by JKR. LET US DREAM. And about Jon/Dany. They are in love then. Okay. Good. And Let’s be real, can we blame them? No. But are they endgame after all political, war, and heir issues. ? Not so sure. I can’t but keep thinking there might be a tragic end for them. (I said might). Or D&D decided to change their habits. En français j'aurais bien sûr dit de ne pas crier victoire trop vite, mais difficile à traduire. Quoiqu'il en soit, si vous voulez discuter de tout cela (Jonerys ou Jonsa) je suis dispo ! (et mes idées sont bien plus claires et étoffées en français)

summary: While the vanity fair article opened my eyes even more to the faults of GOT, I am not about to ignore what was written in those...
body: While the vanity fair article opened my eyes even more to the faults of GOT, I am not about to ignore what was written in those scripts about S@nsa. Knowing the fine details has me going WTF and not because the show totally failed to capture the emotions and motivation in the whole S7 Winterfell storyline. I’m starting to understand why there are theories swimming around about S@nsa betraying another family member, but this time knowingly 😳

Knowing the fine details has me going WTF and not because the show totally failed to capture the emotions and motivation in the whole S7 Winterfell storyline. I’m starting to understand why there are theories swimming around about S@nsa betraying another family member, but this time knowingly 😳

blog.name: cbrownjc
blog.title: Thoughts and Reflections
blog.description:
Tumblr for posting my thoughts, reflections and other stuff pertaining to various things and interests in my life.
Fandoms: Smallville, Buffy, Angel, Harry Potter, Lord of the Rings, The Hobbit, Fullmetal Alchemist, The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya, ASOIAF/GOT, The Legend of Zelda, Video Games, DC Comics, Anime, Manga, Broadway, Musicals.

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: I actually hope D&D don’t get too much blame for the “Tyrion is in love with Dany” thing the Vanity Fair article confirmed from...
body:
I actually hope D&D don’t get too much blame for the “Tyrion is in love with Dany” thing the Vanity Fair article confirmed from the Season 6 and Season 7 scripts. Because I don’t think that is their doing at all. I think that is straight up a George R. R. Martin thing full stop, and it’s going to happen in the books too.

GRRMs original outline for the series had Tyrion falling in love with Arya - and it being unrequited - leading to a Jon / Arya / Tyrion love triangle. It seems clear to me that GRRM changed it to now have Dany in Arya’s place instead. (BTW, I don’t think it was a late-change either. I think it was something he figured out and changed during the writing of the first book).

Honestly, I’m becoming more and more convinced that, though some things got expanded and some things/characters got changed around a bit, the bigger, overall points from Martin’s outline are still in play. The core five characters he mentioned in the original outline (Dany, Tyrion, Bran, Arya and Jon) are still the same core five characters in the book AND on the show. (Some of the more recent promos, especially the recap ones, have those five in them all the time, and sometimes in highlighted ways).

And whatever Martin’s endgame is for the books (if he ever finishes them)? Will be the same for the show. The thing about Tyrion is starting to convince me that, no matter the turns they took with some characters vs their book counterparts, (or whitewashing out the darker shades of grey when it comes to some of these characters), the show versions are going to moved into their book counterparts positions (whatever they are supposed to be) for the endgame.

Possible S8 Spoilers Below! Read at your own risk.

So yeah, I read the spoiler about Tyrion betraying the Starks, being put on trial and being executed for it. And while I’m not sure on the why or what when it comes to the betrayal part of the spoiler, I think there will be one of some sort, and Tyrion will be executed for it. 

GRRMs original notes said the love triangle will turn deadly between Jon and Tyrion. And I think that will what is in play/going on/being set up on the show at the moment.

The audience accepting it will be an entirely other thing however. Taking out some of Tyrion’s darker moments from the book will likely make it a really bitter pill to swallow for a lot of people I’m sure.

summary: Jon has truly never seen a girl like this before. Her beauty, her strength, her grief and the pain it makes him feel… they all...

blog.name: nothinghappensinalstonville
blog.title: Nothing Happens Here
blog.description: And that is just the way I like it - and also why I obsess over GOT. Also cats.

summary: Protector of the Realm My latest gleaning from Fire and Blood is this tidbit regarding Rheanyra's coronation: Three hundred sets...
body:
Protector of the Realm

My latest gleaning from Fire and Blood is this tidbit regarding Rheanyra’s coronation:

Three hundred sets of eyes looked on as Prince Daemon Targaryen placed the Old King’s crown on the head of his wife, proclaiming her Rhaenyra of House Targaryen, First of Her Name, Queen of the Andals, the Rhoynar, and the First Men. The prince claimed for himself the style Protector of the Realm, and Rhaenyra named her eldest son, Jacaerys, the Prince of Dragonstone and heir to the Iron Throne.

It is interesting that ‘Protector of the Realm’ is seen as a title that can be held separately from the King or Queen Regnant. This would indicate that there are duties attached specifically to that title. Is it perhaps a military title that places the holder as Supreme Commander to the Wardens of the North, South, East, and West.

I dug a little deeper and realised that during Jaehaerys I’s regency, Lord Roger Baratheon held the title of Hand of the King and Protector of the Realm. This would indicate to me that the title does hold some power and is separate from the Hand of the King which would appear to be administrative in nature.

When held as a single title he is referred to as the Lord Protector.

I have no particular reason for noting this, beyond pointing out that the bearer of the title has a very specific responsibility to the realm. To keep it safe from enemies within and without.
